wikipedia_page.main: John Chapman (28 November 1814 – 14 April 1896) was an English first-class cricketer active 1842–48 who played for Nottinghamshire. He was born in West Bridgford, Nottingham and died in Gainsborough, Lincolnshire. He appeared in 13 first-class matches.

response: *John Chapman (Leicester MP) represented Leicester (UK Parliament constituency)

*John Chapman (1810–1877), British Member of Parliament for Grimsby, 1862–1865 and 1874–1877
*John Chapman (congressman) (1740–1800), United States Representative from Pennsylvania
*John Chapman Andrew (1822–1907), Member of Parliament in New Zealand
*John Chapman (engineer) (1801–1854), English political and economic writer
*John Chapman (New Zealand cricketer) (1865-1949), New Zealand cricketer
*John Chapman (rugby league), Australian rugby league player
*John Chapman (priest) (1865–1933), British priest, abbot, and religious scholar
*Johnny Appleseed (John Chapman, 1774–1845), pioneer nurseryman and missionary
*John Chapman (publisher) (1821–1894), publisher of the Westminster Review
*John Chapman (Medal of Honor) (1844–1905), French soldier who fought in the American Civil War
*John Chapman (general) (1896–1963), Australian Army general of WWII
